name: 01-array-remove
description: // removes an element from the array at the index // do not use any index array methods like [].splice() // [].pop [].push or anything. // you're only allowed to use a[i], and a[i] = "foo" // //        input: remove([32, 65, 89, 43], 0) // intermediate: [null, 65, 89, 43] //       result:[65, 89, 43] // set the index given to null // write a for loop that shifts all other values over to fill the now null space // manually adjust .length of the array to be one less ``` function remove(arr, index) {   return arr; }
